sentences.en: A clone is identical with the original animal or plant.
sentences.cn: 克隆物与母本动物或植物完全相同.

sentences.en: A template can constrain the cardinality of a clone's attribute.
sentences.cn: 模板可约束复制属性的集势.

sentences.en: Aim : To clone whey acidic protein ( WAP ) promoter and construct the vector.
sentences.cn: 目的: 克隆乳清酸蛋白基因 ( WAP ) 启动子并构建其载体.

sentences.en: At the outset they must contain several ramets of every selected clone.
sentences.cn: 在开始时每个入选无性系必须包括几个无性繁殖后代.

sentences.en: Commander Wolffe's clone troopers have stylized wolf muzzles painted on their helmets.
sentences.cn: 沃尔佛指挥官手下的克隆人士兵在头盔上都绘有标志性的狼嘴图案.

sentences.en: Conclusion Expression clone of human insulin mutant is successfully constructed.
sentences.cn: 结论成功地构建了人胰岛素突变体的融合表达体系,为进一步的研究奠定了基础.

sentences.en: Did the council ever authorize the creation of a clone army?
sentences.cn: 参议会曾经授意建造复制军队 吗 ?

sentences.en: Each clone has the same genetic information as the original.
sentences.cn: 每个无性系都具有与母体相同的遗传信息.

sentences.en: It has become quite common to clone a plant variety.
sentences.cn: 克隆植物品种已很常见.

sentences.en: Obama looks like he is aging rapidly. Is this a clone?
sentences.cn: 奥巴马看起来老得很快啊. 他是个克隆人 吗 ?

sentences.en: Seed stability of clone is a major yield facter in Chinese fir.
sentences.cn: 杉木种子园无性系结实稳定性是高产稳产的重要因素.

sentences.en: The idea of cloning extinct life forms still belongs to science fiction.
sentences.cn: 对绝种的生命形式进行克隆的想法仍然属于科学幻想。

sentences.en: The technology would be similar to that used to clone animals.
sentences.cn: 克隆人的技术与克隆其他动物的技术相似.

sentences.en: Theologians contend that to clone a human would violate human dignity.
sentences.cn: 神学家们认为克隆人类将有损人类的尊严.

sentences.en: Tom was in some ways a younger clone of his handsome father.
sentences.cn: 汤姆在某些方面是他英俊父亲年轻时的翻版。

sentences.en: Would the clone be thought of simply as a clone?
sentences.cn: 克隆应被认为仅仅是“克隆” 吗 ?

sentences.en: You saw the clone do something with Natalie.
sentences.cn: 你看见那个复制品和娜塔莉在做什么?

words.tran_cn: 无性系的；无性繁殖系般的
[生物]克隆；[植][农学][遗]无性系；无性繁殖；靠营养生殖而由母体分离繁殖的植物

trans.tran_cn: 克隆动物/植物，翻版，复制品
trans.tran_en: an animal or plant produced by scientists from one cell of another animal or plant, so that they are exactly the same
an animal or plant produced by scientists from one cell of another animal or plant, so that they are exactly the same
to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially

trans.tran_cn: 克隆， 以无性繁殖技术复制
trans.tran_en: to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially
